main event: On December 9, 1957, a witness observed a bright oval object in the sky near Redlands, California.
interesting points: The object was described as bright white, the size of a half dollar, and stationary before it faded out., A small red light was nearby but was believed not to be related to the main object., The sighting was reported to have lasted for 15 to 20 minutes., The witness noted the observation occurred at dusk, with the object being about 30 degrees above the horizon in the southwest., The bright object was ultimately identified as Venus with the red light thought to be a hazard light on San Antonio Peak.
witness description: The witness described the object as an oval, bright white in color, and stationary.
